Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Transport pursuant to section 5a of the Marine Transportation Security Actb, hereby makes the annexed Domestic Ferries Security Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The purpose of these Regulations is to enhance the security of the Canadian ferry transportation system through the establishment of a framework for detecting security threats and taking preventive measures against security incidents.
These Regulations are divided into five Parts:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: Part 1 sets out general matters that apply to the entire Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: Part 2 sets out the security documentation that must be obtained from the Minister and the manner in which it must be obtained;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: Part 3 sets out the responsibilities of the operators of domestic ferries and domestic ferry facilities;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: Part 4 sets out the roles and responsibilities of the personnel involved in the security of domestic ferries and domestic ferry facilities; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: Part 5 provides a framework for conducting security assessments and for establishing, implementing and maintaining security plans.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Marine Transportation Security Act. (Loi)

certain dangerous cargoes has the meaning assigned by the definition certain dangerous cargoes or CDCs in subsection 1(1) of the Marine Transportation Security Regulations. (certaines cargaisons dangereuses)
domestic ferry means a vessel that is entitled to fly the Canadian flag, carries passengers on a regular schedule and operates on a route set out in Schedule 1. (traversier intérieur)
domestic ferry facility means a marine facility set out in Schedule 2. (installation pour traversiers intérieurs)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a domestic ferry and another vessel or a marine facility; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a domestic ferry facility and a vessel. (interface)

Definition.Text: key means a device, including a card, issued by an operator of a domestic ferry or a domestic ferry facility that is designed to allow access to a restricted area in a domestic ferry or a domestic ferry facility. (clé)
MARSEC level 1 means the level for which minimum security procedures are maintained as set out in the approved security plan. (niveau MARSEC 1)

MARSEC level 2 means the level for which security procedures additional to those of MARSEC level 1 are maintained for a limited period because of heightened risk of a security threat or security incident. (niveau MARSEC 2)

MARSEC level 3 means the level for which security procedures additional to those of MARSEC level 1 and MARSEC level 2 are maintained for a limited period when a security threat or security incident is probable or imminent, whether or not the specific target is identified. (niveau MARSEC 3)
passenger has the meaning assigned by section 2 of the Canada Shipping Act, 2001. (passager)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the operator of a marine facility that is a port authority incorporated under section 8 of the Canada Marine Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the operator of a public port designated under regulations made under section 65 of the Canada Marine Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a group of marine facilities, in close proximity to each other, whose operators agree with each other to be subject to sections 362 to 375 of the Marine Transportation Security Regulations. (organisme portuaire)

Definition.Text: restricted area pass means a document issued by an operator of a domestic ferry or a domestic ferry facility that entitles the holder to have access, during a specified period, to specific restricted areas in domestic ferries or domestic ferry facilities. (laissez-passer de zone réglementée)
security breach means a violation of security regulations, measures, rules or procedures that does not result in a security incident. (infraction à la sûreté)
security documentation means one or more of the following documents issued by the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a Security Assessment Letter of Approval in respect of a domestic ferry issued under subsection 16(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a Security Assessment Letter of Approval in respect of a domestic ferry facility issued under subsection 16(2);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an Interim Domestic Ferry Security Certificate in respect of a domestic ferry issued under subsection 18(1);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a Security Certificate in respect of a domestic ferry issued under paragraph 19(1)(a); and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a Statement of Compliance in respect of a domestic ferry facility issued under paragraph 19(1)(b). (documents de sûreté)

Definition.Text: security incident means an incident that affects the security of a domestic ferry, a domestic ferry facility or an interface. (incident de sûreté)
security threat means any suspicious act or circumstance that could compromise the security of a domestic ferry, a domestic ferry facility or an interface. (menace contre la sûreté)

Subsection.Text: In these Regulations, a reference to an operator shall be read as a reference to the operator of a domestic ferry, the operator of a domestic ferry facility or both.

Section.MarginalNote: Domestic ferries and domestic ferry facilities

Subsection.Text: These Regulations apply to domestic ferries and domestic ferry facilities.
For greater certainty, these Regulations do not apply to ferries that are dismantled or laid-up at a domestic ferry facility.

Section.Text: This Part sets out general matters that apply to the entire Regulations.
The operator of a domestic ferry and the operator of a domestic ferry facility shall ensure that the requirements of these Regulations are met.

The operator of a domestic ferry and the operator of a domestic ferry facility shall maintain MARSEC level 1 at all times unless a higher MARSEC level is required by a security measure formulated by the Minister under section 7 of the Act.
No person shall tamper with, damage or disrupt the normal operation of any security equipment or system to which these Regulations apply.

This Part sets out the security documentation that must be obtained from the Minister and the manner in which it must be obtained. It also sets out the security documentation that must be carried on board domestic ferries.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) to (4), no person shall operate a domestic ferry without

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an Interim Domestic Ferry Security Certificate in respect of the ferry issued under subsection 18(1) within the preceding 90 days; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a Security Certificate in respect of the ferry issued under paragraph 19(1)(a).

Subsection.Text: The operator of a domestic ferry is deemed to comply with the requirements of subsection (1) if any of the following documents have been issued in respect of the ferry:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a valid International Ship Security Certificate or a valid interim International Ship Security Certificate that is issued under subsection 202(1) or (3) of the Marine Transportation Security Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a valid Canadian Vessel Security Certificate issued by the Minister under subsection 202(2) of the Marine Transportation Security Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a valid interim Canadian Vessel Security Certificate issued by the Minister under subsection 202(3) of the Marine Transportation Security Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply before January 15, 2010 to a domestic ferry operating on a route set out in Part 1 of Schedule 1.
Subsection (1) does not apply before April 1, 2010 to a domestic ferry operating on a route set out in Parts 2 to 4 of Schedule 1.
Subject to subsections (2) to (4), no person shall operate a domestic ferry facility without a Statement of Compliance in respect of the ferry facility issued under paragraph 19(1)(b).

The operator of a domestic ferry facility is deemed to comply with the requirements of subsection (1) if the Minister has issued a letter of approval in respect of the ferry facility under subsection 352(1) of the Marine Transportation Security Regulations.
Subsection (1) does not apply before January 15, 2010 to a domestic ferry facility set out in Part 1 of Schedule 2.
Subsection (1) does not apply before April 1, 2010 to a domestic ferry facility set out in Parts 2 to 4 of Schedule 2.

Heading.TitleText: Procedure for Issuance of Security Documentation

Subsection.Text: The procedure for the issuance of security documentation in respect of a domestic ferry is the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the operator of the ferry submits to the Minister a security assessment report in respect of the ferry in accordance with subsection 15(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister issues to the operator of the ferry a Security Assessment Letter of Approval in respect of the ferry in accordance with subsection 16(1);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the operator of the ferry submits to the Minister a security plan in respect of the ferry in accordance with subsection 17(1);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister issues to the operator of the ferry an Interim Domestic Ferry Security Certificate in respect of the ferry in accordance with subsection 18(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister issues to the operator of the ferry a Security Certificate in respect of the ferry in accordance with paragraph 19(1)(a).

Subsection.Text: The procedure for the issuance of security documentation in respect of a domestic ferry facility is the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the operator of the ferry facility submits to the Minister a security assessment report in respect of the ferry facility in accordance with subsection 15(2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister issues to the operator of the ferry facility a Security Assessment Letter of Approval in respect of the ferry facility in accordance with subsection 16(2);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the operator of the ferry facility submits to the Minister a security plan in respect of the ferry facility in accordance with subsection 17(2); and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister issues to the operator of the ferry facility a Statement of Compliance in respect of the ferry facility in accordance with paragraph 19(1)(b).

Heading.TitleText: Submission of Security Assessment by Operator

Subsection.Text: In order to obtain a Security Certificate in respect of a domestic ferry, the operator of the ferry shall submit to the Minister for approval a security assessment report in respect of the ferry that contains the elements set out in section 70.

In order to obtain a Statement of Compliance in respect of a domestic ferry facility, the operator of the ferry facility shall submit to the Minister for approval a security assessment report in respect of the ferry facility that contains the elements set out in section 70.
The documents submitted to the Minister under subsections (1) and (2) shall be signed in ink by the operator.

Heading.TitleText: Issuance of Letter of Approval by Minister

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall approve a security assessment report in respect of a domestic ferry and issue to the operator of the ferry a Security Assessment Letter of Approval in respect of the ferry if the Minister is satisfied that the security assessment submitted by the operator meets the requirements of sections 66 to 70.

The Minister shall approve a security assessment report in respect of a domestic ferry facility and issue to the operator of the ferry facility a Security Assessment Letter of Approval in respect of the ferry facility if the Minister is satisfied that the security assessment submitted by the operator meets the requirements of sections 66 to 70.

Heading.TitleText: Submission of Security Plan by Operator

Subsection.Text: After receiving a Security Assessment Letter of Approval in respect of a domestic ferry, the operator of the ferry shall submit to the Minister for approval a security plan that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: addresses the analysis and recommendations set out in the approved security assessment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meets the requirements of sections 71 to 73.

Subsection.Text: After receiving a Security Assessment Letter of Approval in respect of a domestic ferry facility, the operator of the ferry facility shall submit to the Minister for approval a security plan that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: addresses the analysis and recommendations set out in the approved security assessment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meets the requirements of sections 71, 72 and 74.

Subsection.Text: The documents submitted to the Minister under subsections (1) and (2) shall be signed in ink by the operator.

Heading.TitleText: Approval of Security Plan by Minister

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall approve a security plan in respect of a domestic ferry and issue to the operator of the ferry an Interim Domestic Ferry Security Certificate in respect of the ferry if the Minister is satisfied that the security plan submitted by the operator

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: meets the requirements of sections 71 to 73; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sets out adequate systems to address or respond to security threats, security breaches and security incidents.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall approve a security plan in respect of a domestic ferry facility if the Minister is satisfied that the security plan submitted by the operator

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: meets the requirements of sections 71, 72 and 74; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sets out adequate systems to address or respond to security threats, security breaches and security incidents.

Subsection.Text: A security plan approved by the Minister is valid for a period fixed by the Minister, which shall not exceed five years after the date on which it is approved. In fixing the period, the Minister shall consider the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a domestic ferry,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its operations and the industry in which it operates,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its ports of call and usual routes,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the operator’s security record, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the complexity of its security plan and the details of its procedures; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a domestic ferry facility,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its operations and the industry in which it operates,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the operator’s security record, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the complexity of its security plan and the details of its procedures.

Heading.TitleText: Issuance of Security Certificate and Statement of Compliance

Subsection.Text: If the Minister is satisfied, on the basis of an inspection conducted under section 23 of the Act, that the procedures set out in the approved security plan in respect of a domestic ferry or a domestic ferry facility are implemented, the Minister shall issue to the operator of the ferry or the ferry facility, in English or French,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a domestic ferry, a Security Certificate; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a domestic ferry facility, a Statement of Compliance.

Subsection.Text: A Security Certificate or a Statement of Compliance issued under subsection (1) is valid while the approved security plan in respect of the domestic ferry or the domestic ferry facility is valid.
Subject to subsections (2) to (4), the operator of a domestic ferry shall ensure that the ferry carries on board

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an approved security plan in respect of the ferry; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a Security Certificate issued in respect of the ferry, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if a Security Certificate has not been issued, an Interim Domestic Ferry Security Certificate issued in respect of the ferry.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Compliance with the Marine Transportation Security Regulations
Subsection.Text: In the case of a domestic ferry to which subsection 12(2) applies, the operator of the ferry shall ensure that the ferry carries on board

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a certificate referred to in that subsection that was issued in respect of the ferry; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a vessel security plan referred to in paragraph 204(1)(b) of the Marine Transportation Security Regulations that was approved in respect of the ferry.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply before January 15, 2010 to a domestic ferry operating on a route set out in Part 1 of Schedule 1.
Subsection (1) does not apply before April 1, 2010 to a domestic ferry operating on a route set out in Parts 2 to 4 of Schedule 1.

Section.Text: This Part sets out the responsibilities of the operators of domestic ferries and domestic ferry facilities, including specific rules relating to restricted area passes and keys and the replacement of ferries.

Subsection.Text: The operator of a domestic ferry shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: establish an administrative and organizational structure for the security of the ferry;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide each of its employees having responsibilities under these Regulations with the technical assistance and the training necessary to fulfil those responsibilities;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: designate a ferry security officer in writing by name or by position, other than the position for which the designation is being made;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: provide the ferry security officer with information regarding security threats and with other information relevant to security;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the security assessment in respect of the ferry is carried out and submitted to the Minister for approval;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the security plan in respect of the ferry is developed and submitted to the Minister for approval;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the approved security plan in respect of the ferry is implemented and maintained, and that any amendments to the plan are submitted to the Minister for approval;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if the ferry is interfacing with a domestic ferry facility, ensure coordination of the approved security plan in respect of the ferry with the approved security plan in respect of the ferry facility;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the security activities of the ferry are audited;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: amend as soon as practicable the approved security plan in respect of the ferry to correct any deficiency identified as a result of an audit or in the course of operations;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that corrective action is implemented as soon as practicable to correct any deficiency referred to in paragraph (j) until the approved security plan in respect of the ferry is amended;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: ensure security awareness and vigilance by all personnel on the ferry;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the security orientation referred to in section 59 is provided;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that there is effective communication and cooperation during each interface;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that there is consistency between the security requirements and the safety requirements;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: clearly mark restricted areas on the ferry with signs;

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the ferry has communication systems, including a backup system, and communication procedures that allow effective communication between the ferry and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: other vessels, marine facilities, and port administrations,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: local law enforcement agencies; and

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: immediately notify the Minister if the operator ceases to operate a ferry on a route set out in Schedule 1.

Subsection.Text: The operator of a domestic ferry facility shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: establish an administrative and organizational structure for the security of the ferry facility;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide each of its employees having responsibilities under these Regulations with the technical assistance and the training necessary to fulfil their responsibilities;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: designate a ferry facility security officer in writing by name or by position, other than the position for which the designation is being made;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: provide the ferry facility security officer with information regarding security threats and with other information relevant to security;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the security assessment in respect of the ferry facility is carried out and submitted to the Minister for approval;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the security plan in respect of the ferry facility is developed and submitted to the Minister for approval;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the approved security plan in respect of the ferry facility is implemented and maintained, and that any amendments to the plan are submitted to the Minister for approval;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: coordinate with the master of a domestic ferry, and with the port security officer if the ferry facility is in a port, crew changes as well as access to the ferry through the ferry facility by visitors and passengers, including representatives of seafarers’ welfare and labour organizations;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the security activities of the ferry facility are audited;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: amend as soon as practicable the approved security plan in respect of the ferry facility to correct any deficiency identified as a result of an audit or in the course of operations;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that corrective action is implemented as soon as practicable to correct any deficiency referred to in paragraph (j) until the approved security plan in respect of the ferry facility is amended;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: ensure security awareness and vigilance by all personnel at the ferry facility;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the security orientation referred to in section 59 is provided;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that there is effective communication and cooperation during each interface;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that there is consistency between the security requirements and the safety requirements;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: clearly mark restricted areas in the ferry facility with signs;

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the ferry facility has communication systems, including a backup system, and communication procedures that allow effective communication between the ferry facility and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: vessels, other marine facilities, and port administrations,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: local law enforcement agencies;

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: immediately notify the Minister if the operator ceases to operate a ferry facility set out in Schedule 2; and

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the ferry facility security officer develops a security plan in respect of the ferry facility in consultation with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: local law enforcement agencies,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: emergency response providers,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: employers and labour at the ferry facility, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the port security officer, if the ferry facility is in a port.

Subsection.Text: If the operator of a domestic ferry also operates the domestic ferry facilities with which the ferry interfaces, the operator may designate a security officer to act for both the ferry and the ferry facilities if the officer is able to fulfil their responsibilities for each ferry and each ferry facility.

A person designated as security officer under paragraphs (1)(c) or (2)(c) may accept other responsibilities or appointments within the operator’s organization provided that the person is able to fulfil their responsibilities as security officer.

Section.Text: The operator of a domestic ferry shall ensure that a ferry security officer is on board each domestic ferry that it operates.

Subsection.Text: An operator shall issue a restricted area pass or key for controlling access to restricted areas established by the operator.
An operator may issue a restricted area pass or key only to a person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: who requires access to a restricted area in the performance of their duties; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: who is known to the operator or whose identity has been confirmed by valid government-issued photo identification.

Section.Text: A restricted area pass shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: show the name, height and eye colour of the person to whom the pass has been issued, a clear photograph of the person’s head and shoulders, and an expiry date that does not exceed five years after the date of issue; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contain an expiry date or other information to indicate the period during which access is required, and sufficient information to allow the identification of the pass holder.

Subsection.Text: The holder of a restricted area pass shall, when entering or remaining in a restricted area, display the pass on their outer clothing and above their waist with their photo visible at all times.
The holder of a restricted area pass or key shall not use the restricted area pass or key except in the performance of their duties.

Section.Text: No person shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide false information for the purpose of obtaining a restricted area pass or key;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: loan or give a restricted area pass or key to a person other than the individual to whom it was issued;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: have or use a restricted area pass or key that was issued to another person;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: alter or otherwise modify a restricted area pass or key;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: use a counterfeit restricted area pass or key; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: reproduce a restricted area pass or key unless authorized to do so by the operator who issued the pass or key.

Heading.TitleText: Loss or Theft of Restricted Area Pass or Key

Subsection.Text: The holder of a restricted area pass or key that is lost or stolen shall immediately report its loss or theft to the operator who issued the pass or key.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Blocking of lost or stolen key
Subsection.Text: The operator shall immediately prevent the use of a restricted area pass or key upon being notified of its loss or theft.

Heading.TitleText: Return of Restricted Area Pass or Key

Section.Text: The holder of a restricted area pass or key shall return it immediately to the operator who issued it when

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder ceases to work on the domestic ferry or in the domestic ferry facility; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the operator determines that the holder otherwise ceases to require the restricted area pass or key.

Heading.TitleText: Administration of Restricted Area Passes and Keys

Subsection.Text: An operator shall keep a record of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number of restricted area passes and keys issued and, for each pass and key, the name of the holder, the number of the pass or key, the date of issue, the period of validity of the pass, and, if applicable, the date of return; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: lost or stolen passes or keys.

Subsection.Text: An operator shall ensure that the record referred to in subsection (1) is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: kept for at least two years after the date of expiry or return of the restricted area passes or keys; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: made available to the Minister on request.

Subsection.Text: If a domestic ferry facility is located in a port, the port administration may issue restricted area passes and keys on behalf of the operator of the ferry facility. In this case, the operator shall cooperate with the port administration and shall provide it with the information required.

Section.Text: If the operator of a domestic ferry decides to replace it with another ferry, the operator shall ensure that the following are notified of the replacement:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the ferry security officers of both the replacement ferry and the replaced ferry; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the ferry facility security officer of each domestic ferry facility with which the replacement ferry will interface on that route.

Section.Text: This Part sets out the roles and responsibilities of the personnel involved in the security of domestic ferries and domestic ferry facilities.

Subsection.Text: Nothing in these Regulations permits any person to constrain the master of a domestic ferry from making or executing any decision that, in the professional judgment of the master, is necessary to maintain the safety and security of the ferry, including decisions

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to deny access to persons other than the following and, where applicable, their goods:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the operator of the ferry,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the operator of the domestic ferry facility with which the ferry interfaces,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: persons authorized by the Government of Canada to board the ferry,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: local law enforcement personnel in the exercise of their functions, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: emergency response personnel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to refuse to load cargo, including containers or other closed cargo transport units; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to coordinate with the operator of a domestic ferry facility, and with the port security officer if the ferry facility is in a port, crew changes as well as access to the ferry through the ferry facility by visitors and passengers, including representatives of seafarers’ welfare and labour organizations.

Subsection.Text: If a conflict between any safety and security requirements applicable to a domestic ferry arises during its operations, the master of the ferry shall give precedence to requirements intended to maintain the safety of the ferry and shall, in such a case, use any temporary procedures that the master determines appropriate under the circumstances and that satisfy, to the highest possible degree, the security requirements of the MARSEC level in effect.
If the master of a domestic ferry uses temporary procedures, the master shall inform the Minister as soon as practicable.
The master of a domestic ferry shall provide the ferry security officer with the support necessary to carry out their duties on board the ferry.

Heading.TitleText: Ferry Security Officer and Ferry Facility Security Officer

Subsection.Text: A ferry security officer and a ferry facility security officer may delegate tasks required by these Regulations, but they remain responsible for the performance of those tasks.
The ferry security officer of a domestic ferry must be the master of the ferry or a member of its crew.
A ferry facility security officer may act in that capacity for more than one domestic ferry facility if they are able to fulfil their responsibilities for each ferry facility.
A ferry security officer shall have, by training or job experience, knowledge and competence relevant to the ferry industry, including in the following areas:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the administrative and organizational structure for the security of the domestic ferry and of the ferry facilities with which the ferry interfaces;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the operations and operating conditions of ferries, ferry facilities and, if applicable, port administrations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the relevant security procedures of ferries, ferry facilities and, if applicable, port administrations, including the meaning and the requirements of the different MARSEC levels;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: emergency preparedness and response, and contingency planning;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: security equipment and systems, and their operational limitations;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: methods of conducting audits and inspections;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: techniques for controlling and monitoring access;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: methods of conducting ferry security assessments;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: methods of conducting physical searches and non-intrusive inspections;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the conduct and assessment of security drills and exercises for ferries and ferry facilities;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: techniques for security training and education;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: relevant Acts and regulations, and relevant security measures, rules and procedures;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the responsibilities and functions of local law enforcement agencies;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: methods of handling security-sensitive information and security-related communications;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: current security threats and patterns;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: the recognition and detection of weapons, explosives, incendiaries, and other dangerous substances and devices;

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: the recognition of the characteristics and behavioural patterns of persons who are likely to threaten security;

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: techniques that might be used to violate security procedures or to circumvent security procedures, equipment or systems;

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: the layout of the ferry;

Paragraph.Label: (t)
Paragraph.Text: the approved security plan in respect of the ferry and the plan’s requirements;

Paragraph.Label: (u)
Paragraph.Text: crowd management and control techniques; and

Paragraph.Label: (v)
Paragraph.Text: the relevant procedures for the operation, testing, calibration and maintenance of security equipment and systems.

Subsection.Text: A ferry facility security officer shall have, by training or job experience, knowledge and competence relevant to the ferry industry, including in the following areas:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the administrative and organizational structure for the security of the domestic ferry facility and of the domestic ferries with which the ferry facility interfaces;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the operations and operating conditions of ferry facilities, ferries and, if applicable, port administrations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the relevant security procedures of ferry facilities, ferries and, if applicable, port administrations, including the meaning and the requirements of the different MARSEC levels;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: emergency preparedness and response, and contingency planning;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: security equipment and systems, and their operational limitations;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: methods of conducting audits and inspections;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: techniques for controlling and monitoring access;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: methods of conducting ferry facility security assessments;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: methods of conducting physical searches and non-intrusive inspections;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the conduct and assessment of security drills and exercises for ferry facilities and ferries;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: techniques for security training and education;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: relevant Acts and regulations, and relevant security measures, rules and procedures;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the responsibilities and functions of local law enforcement agencies;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: methods of handling security-sensitive information and security-related communications;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: current security threats and patterns;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: the recognition and detection of weapons, explosives, incendiaries, and other dangerous substances and devices;

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: the recognition of the characteristics and behavioural patterns of persons who are likely to threaten security;

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: techniques that might be used to violate security procedures or to circumvent security procedures, equipment or systems;

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: the layout of the ferry facility;

Paragraph.Label: (t)
Paragraph.Text: the approved security plan in respect of the ferry facility and the plan’s requirements;

Paragraph.Label: (u)
Paragraph.Text: crowd management and control techniques; and

Paragraph.Label: (v)
Paragraph.Text: the relevant procedures for the operation, testing, calibration and maintenance of security equipment and systems.

Subsection.Text: A ferry security officer shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide the required information to the persons conducting the security assessment in respect of the domestic ferry;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: implement the approved security plan in respect of the ferry, as amended from time to time, in coordination with its operator, the ferry facility security officer and, if applicable, the port security officer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: conduct inspections of the ferry to ensure compliance with the requirements of these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: as soon as practicable after a deficiency in the approved security plan in respect of the ferry is identified, report it to its operator and implement the action necessary to correct the deficiency until the plan is amended;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: ensure security awareness and vigilance by all personnel on the ferry, including awareness of changes in the MARSEC level and of other circumstances that might affect work conditions;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that appropriate security training or orientation is provided to the ferry’s personnel in accordance with these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: report security threats and security incidents to the master, to its operator, to local law enforcement agencies and to the Minister as soon as possible after they occur;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: report security breaches to the Minister and, if applicable, to the port administration as soon as possible after they occur;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that there is effective communication and cooperation between the ferry and the ferry facilities with which it interfaces;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that security equipment is operated, tested, calibrated and maintained;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: keep readily accessible a copy of the approved security assessment and the approved security plan in respect of the ferry; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: conduct security drills and exercises.

Subsection.Text: A ferry facility security officer shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide the required information to the persons conducting the security assessment in respect of the domestic ferry facility;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: implement the approved security plan in respect of the ferry facility, as amended from time to time, in coordination with its operator, the ferry security officer and, if applicable, the port security officer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: conduct inspections of the ferry facility to ensure compliance with the requirements of these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: as soon as practicable after a deficiency in the approved security plan in respect of the ferry facility is identified, report it to the operator and implement the action necessary to correct the deficiency until the plan is amended;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: ensure security awareness and vigilance by all personnel at the ferry facility, including awareness of changes in the MARSEC level and of other circumstances that might affect work conditions;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that appropriate security training or orientation is provided to the ferry facility personnel in accordance with these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: report security threats and security incidents to the operator of the ferry facility, to local law enforcement agencies, to the Minister and, if applicable, to the port administration as soon as possible after they occur;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: report security breaches to the Minister and, if applicable, to the port administration as soon as possible after they occur;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that there is effective communication and cooperation between the ferry facility and any domestic ferry with which it interfaces;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that security equipment is operated, tested, calibrated and maintained;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: keep readily accessible a copy of the approved security assessment and the approved security plan in respect of the ferry facility; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: conduct security drills and exercises.

Section.Text: Domestic ferry personnel and domestic ferry facility personnel with security responsibilities, other than the ferry security officer or the ferry facility security officer, shall have, by training or equivalent job experience, knowledge and competence relevant to the ferry industry in any of the following areas that relate to their responsibilities:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: current security threats and patterns;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the recognition and detection of weapons, explosives, incendiaries, and other dangerous substances and devices;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the recognition of the characteristics and behavioural patterns of persons who are likely to threaten security;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: techniques that might be used to violate security procedures or to circumvent security procedures, equipment or systems;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: crowd management and control techniques;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: security-related communications;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: emergency preparedness and response, and contingency planning;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the operation, testing, calibration and maintenance of security equipment and systems;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: inspection and monitoring techniques;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: methods of conducting physical searches of persons and goods, including personal effects, baggage, ships’ stores and cargo;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the relevant provisions of the approved security plan in respect of the domestic ferry or in respect of the domestic ferry facility, as the case may be; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the meaning and the requirements of the different MARSEC levels.

Section.Text: The operator shall provide, to all personnel without security responsibilities and to all contractors, security orientation with respect to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the relevant provisions of the approved security plan in respect of the domestic ferry or the domestic ferry facility, as the case may be; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the relevant requirements of the different MARSEC levels, including emergency procedures and contingency plans.

Section.MarginalNote: Framework for security assessments and security plans
Section.Text: This Part provides a framework

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for conducting security assessments in order to put in place plans and procedures for responding to changes in the security environment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for ensuring that adequate and proportionate security procedures are established and implemented to prevent, address or respond to security threats, security breaches and security incidents; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for auditing and amending security plans.

Heading.TitleText: Requirements for Persons Providing Security Assessment Information

Subsection.Text: The persons conducting or providing information for a security assessment in respect of a domestic ferry or a domestic ferry facility shall have the skills necessary to evaluate the security of the ferry or the ferry facility, as the case may be, including knowledge in the following areas:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: current security threats and patterns;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the detection and recognition of weapons, explosives, incendiaries, and other dangerous substances and devices;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the recognition of the characteristics and behavioural patterns of persons who are likely to threaten security;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: techniques that might be used to violate security procedures or to circumvent security procedures, equipment or systems;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: methods used to cause a security incident;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the effects of dangerous substances and devices on vessels and their equipment, structures and essential services;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the security requirements of the ferry or the ferry facility;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: interface practices;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: emergency preparedness and response, and contingency planning;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: physical security requirements;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: radio and telecommunications systems, including computer systems and networks;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the security assessment of a ferry, marine engineering, and in the case of the security assessment of a ferry facility, marine or civil engineering;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: other elements that might, if damaged or used illicitly, pose a risk to people, property or operations; and

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: ferry and ferry facility operations.

Subsection.Text: The persons referred to in subsection (1) may draw upon external expert assistance in relation to the areas listed in that subsection.

Section.Text: A security assessment shall address the following elements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: physical security;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: structural integrity;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: personnel protection systems;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: operational procedures that might impact on security;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: radio and telecommunications systems, including computer systems and networks; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: utilities and relevant transportation support infrastructure.

Section.Text: A ferry security officer and a ferry facility security officer shall ensure that an on-site security assessment is conducted that examines and evaluates protective measures, procedures and operations in effect at a domestic ferry or a domestic ferry facility, as the case may be, in order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure the performance of all security duties;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: control access through the use of identification systems or through other means;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: control the embarkation of personnel and other persons and their goods, including personal effects, vehicles and baggage, whether accompanied or unaccompanied;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: supervise the handling of cargo, if any, and the delivery of ships’ stores and bunkers;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: monitor restricted areas to ensure that only authorized persons have access to them;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: monitor the deck areas and the areas adjacent to the ferry; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the security communication systems, information and equipment are readily available.

Subsection.Text: A person who conducts a security assessment shall take into account the security assessment information, the on-site security assessment and the requirements of these Regulations in order to provide recommendations for the security procedures to be established in the security plan in respect of the domestic ferry or the domestic ferry facility, including recommendations respecting

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: restricted areas;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: response procedures for fire or other emergency situations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: security supervision of all persons on a ferry or at a ferry facility;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the frequency and effectiveness of security patrols;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: access control systems;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: security communication systems;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: security doors, barriers and lighting;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: security and surveillance equipment and systems; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the evaluation of the potential for each identified point of access on a ferry, including open decks, to be used by individuals who might try to breach security, whether or not those individuals legitimately have access to the ferry.

Subsection.Text: A security assessment in respect of a domestic ferry or a domestic ferry facility shall take into account the following potential threats:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: damage to or destruction of the ferry or the ferry facility by explosive devices, arson, sabotage or vandalism;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: tampering with essential equipment or systems, ships’ stores or cargo;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the unauthorized access to or use of the ferry or the ferry facility, including the presence of stowaways;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the smuggling on the ferry or at the ferry facility of weapons, explosives, incendiaries or other dangerous substances or devices, including weapons of mass destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the use of the ferry or its equipment, or the use of ferry facility equipment, as a weapon or as a means of causing damage or destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the hijacking of the ferry, the seizure of the ferry facility, and the seizure of any persons on the ferry or at the ferry facility;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: attacks on the ferry while it is at berth, at anchor or in movement; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the use of the ferry facility or its equipment by persons intending to cause a security incident.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a domestic ferry, the security assessment shall consider the security of all persons, operations and goods that it is important to protect, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the capacity to maintain safe navigation and to respond to any emergency situation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cargo, if any, particularly dangerous goods or substances;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: ships’ stores and bunkers;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the ferry’s security communication and surveillance systems; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any other security systems.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a domestic ferry facility, the security assessment shall include a vulnerability assessment to determine the following, so as to produce an overall assessment of the level of risk for which security procedures have to be developed:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any particular aspect of the ferry facility, including vessel traffic in the vicinity, that might make the ferry facility a target of an attack;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the potential consequences of an attack on or at the ferry facility in terms of loss of life, damage to property and economic disruption, including the disruption of marine transportation systems;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the capability and intent of persons likely to mount an attack;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the potential types of attack;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: current security procedures, including identification systems;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: methods and points of access to the ferry facility;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the procedures to protect radio and telecommunications equipment, including computer systems and networks;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any conflict between safety and security procedures;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: any implementation or personnel constraints;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: methods of monitoring restricted areas to ensure that only authorized persons have access to them;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: areas adjacent to the ferry facility that might be exploited during or for an attack;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: current security procedures relating to utilities and other services;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: any deficiency identified during drills or exercises;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: any deficiencies identified during daily operations, or following incidents or alerts, reports of security concerns, the application of control measures or audits; and

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: the structural integrity of the ferry facility.

Heading.TitleText: Content of the Security Assessment Report

Section.Text: A security assessment report shall be written in English or French and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a summary of how the on-site security assessment was conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: details of existing security procedures and operations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of each vulnerability found during the security assessment;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the security procedures to be used to address each vulnerability;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the essential operations that it is important to protect; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: possible security threats to those operations.

Subsection.Text: A security plan shall be established in respect of each domestic ferry and each domestic ferry facility.
The security plan shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be written in English or French;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: state the name of the operator;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be based on the findings of the security assessment;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: address each vulnerability identified in the security assessment; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: state procedures for cooperating with emergency response personnel at all MARSEC levels.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Structure and presentation of security plan
Subsection.Text: A security plan shall include the following individual sections and, if the plan does not list the sections in the following order, it shall contain a table of contents that identifies the location of the sections:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: organizational structure for security;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: personnel training;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: drills and exercises;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: records and documentation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: response to a change in the MARSEC level;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for an interface;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: communications;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: maintenance of security systems and equipment;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: security procedures for access control;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: security procedures for restricted areas;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: security procedures for handling cargo, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: security procedures for delivery of ships’ stores and bunkers;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: security procedures for monitoring;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for security threats, security breaches and security incidents;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: security assessment summary; and

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: security plan audits and amendments.

Section.Text: A security plan shall address the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for the prevention of unauthorized access;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for the establishment and identification of restricted areas, for controlling access to those areas, and respecting any security equipment or systems for those areas;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: security of information relating to record keeping and referred to in section 103;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for embarking and disembarking passengers and for loading and unloading vehicles, cargo, if any, and ships’ stores and bunkers;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for monitoring the domestic ferry and domestic ferry facility, including restricted areas and the areas adjacent to them;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for responding to security threats, security breaches and security incidents, including provisions for maintaining critical operations;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for evacuation in case of security threats, security breaches or security incidents;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for reporting security threats, security breaches and security incidents to local law enforcement agencies, to the Minister and, if applicable, to the port administration;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for responding to any security measures formulated by the Minister and, in the case of a domestic ferry, any directions issued by the Minister in respect of a specific security threat, including changes in the MARSEC level;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: duties of personnel assigned security responsibilities and of other personnel with respect to security-related matters;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: communications;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for training, drills, and exercises associated with the security plan;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for interfacing at all MARSEC levels;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for the periodic review of the plan and for updating it;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: procedures to ensure the inspection, testing, calibration and maintenance of any security equipment;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: the frequency of the testing or calibration of any security equipment;

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: the frequency of inspections;

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for securing non-critical operations in order to focus response on critical operations; and

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: any other security procedures at each MARSEC level, if applicable.

Heading.TitleText: Security Plan in respect of a Domestic Ferry

Section.Text: A security plan in respect of a domestic ferry shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: identify the ferry security officer by name or, if they hold another position, by position, and provide 24-hour contact information for the officer; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: specify that the ferry’s master has the overriding authority and responsibility to make decisions with respect to the security of the ferry and to request the assistance of the ferry operator or the Minister when necessary.

Heading.TitleText: Security Plan in respect of a Domestic Ferry Facility

Section.Text: A security plan in respect of a domestic ferry facility shall identify the ferry facility security officer by name or, if they hold another position, by position, and provide 24-hour contact information for the officer.

Subsection.Text: Security procedures for controlling access to a domestic ferry and a domestic ferry facility shall be established in their respective security plans for all MARSEC levels, as appropriate to their operations, in order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prevent persons from introducing unauthorized weapons, explosives, incendiaries, and other dangerous substances and devices on the ferry or at the ferry facility;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: secure weapons, explosives, incendiaries, and other dangerous substances and devices that are authorized to be on the ferry or at the ferry facility;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: verify the identity of ferry personnel, ferry facility personnel and any other authorized personnel;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: indicate the frequency of access controls, particularly if they are carried out on a random or occasional basis;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: verify that passengers have valid tickets; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that unattended goods do not pose an immediate threat to marine security.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a domestic ferry,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: security procedures shall be established in the security plan in respect of the ferry, for all MARSEC levels, as appropriate to its operations, to control access to ladders, access gangways, access ramps, access doors, side scuttles, windows and ports, hatches, mooring lines, anchor chains and hoisting gear; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: at all MARSEC levels, the ferry security officer shall, after any period during which the ferry was unattended, ensure that security sweeps are performed in order to confirm the absence of security threats or dangerous substances or devices before the ferry gets under way.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a domestic ferry facility, security procedures shall be established in the security plan in respect of the ferry facility for all MARSEC levels, as appropriate to its operations, to identify

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the locations at which restrictions or prohibitions preventing unauthorized access are to be applied; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the types of restrictions or prohibitions to be applied and the means of applying them.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a domestic ferry, security procedures for access control at MARSEC level 1 shall be established in the security plan in respect of the ferry, as appropriate to its operations, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: searching selected areas before passengers embark;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: securing all non-passenger areas; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: at least one of the following methods:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: conducting security patrols,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: using additional closed-circuit video cameras to monitor passenger areas, vehicles and baggage.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a domestic ferry facility, security procedures for access control at MARSEC level 1 shall be established in the security plan in respect of the ferry facility, as appropriate to its operations, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appropriate access controls for restricted areas;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: identification of access points that must be secured or guarded to prevent unauthorized access; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: methods to prevent unauthorized access to the ferry facility and to restricted areas.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a domestic ferry, additional security procedures for access control at MARSEC level 2 shall be established in the security plan in respect of the ferry, as appropriate to its operations, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: increasing the frequency and detail of the security procedures set out in subsection 76(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: increasing the frequency of the security sweeps referred to in paragraph 75(2)(b).

Subsection.Text: In the case of a domestic ferry facility, additional security procedures for access control at MARSEC level 2 shall be established in the security plan in respect of the ferry facility, as appropriate to its operations, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: increasing the frequency and detail of the security procedures set out in subsection 76(2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: assigning additional personnel to guard access points and to patrol the perimeter of the ferry facility to deter unauthorized access;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: limiting the number of access points to the ferry facility by closing and securing some access points and providing physical barriers to impede movement through the remaining access points; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: coordinating the deterrence of waterside access to the domestic ferry in liaison with the ferry facility or a port administration.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a domestic ferry, additional security procedures for access control at MARSEC level 3 shall be established in the security plan in respect of the ferry, as appropriate to its operations, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: increasing the frequency of MARSEC level 2 security procedures;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: preparing for a full or partial search of the ferry;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: cooperating with emergency response personnel, other vessels and marine facilities;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: limiting access to the ferry to a single, controlled access point;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: granting access only to emergency response personnel responding to a security incident or security threat;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: suspending embarkation or disembarkation activities;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: suspending cargo operations, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: moving the ferry; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: evacuating the ferry.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a domestic ferry facility, additional security procedures for access control at MARSEC level 3 shall be established in the security plan in respect of the ferry facility, as appropriate to its operations, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: preparing for a full or partial search of the ferry facility;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cooperating with emergency response personnel, vessels and other marine facilities;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: granting access only to emergency response personnel responding to a security incident or security threat;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: suspending access to the ferry facility;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: suspending cargo operations, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: restricting pedestrian or vehicular movement on the grounds of the ferry facility;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: increasing monitoring at the ferry facility; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: evacuating the ferry facility.

Subsection.Text: Restricted areas on a domestic ferry and at a domestic ferry facility shall be designated for all MARSEC levels in their respective security plans, as appropriate to their operations, in order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prevent or deter unauthorized access;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: protect the ferry or the ferry facility, including security areas, security and surveillance equipment and systems, and persons authorized to be on the ferry or at the ferry facility; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: protect cargo, if any, ships’ stores and bunkers from tampering.

Subsection.Text: The operator shall post, at each restricted area access point and on each security barrier, signs that identify each restricted area and state that entry is restricted to authorized persons.

Section.MarginalNote: Security plan in respect of the domestic ferry

Subsection.Text: In a security plan in respect of a domestic ferry, the following shall be established as restricted areas:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the navigation bridge, machinery spaces, and other control stations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: spaces containing the central controls for security and surveillance equipment and systems, and for the lighting system;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: spaces containing ventilation and air-conditioning systems, and other similar spaces;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: access points for potable water tanks, pumps and manifolds;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: spaces containing dangerous goods or hazardous substances;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: spaces containing cargo pumps and their controls;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: cargo spaces, if any, and spaces containing ships’ stores;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: crew accommodations, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: any other spaces or areas vital to the security of the ferry.

Subsection.Text: In a security plan in respect of a domestic ferry facility, the following shall be established as restricted areas:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: areas on land where ferries interface with the ferry facility, including passenger areas, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: areas in which security-sensitive information is kept, including cargo documentation, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: areas containing the central controls for security and surveillance equipment and systems, and for the central lighting system;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: areas containing the ferry facility’s critical infrastructure, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: water supplies,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: telecommunications,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: electrical systems, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: access points for ventilation and air-conditioning systems;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: areas in the ferry facility where it is reasonable to restrict access to vehicles and persons; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: areas designated for the loading, unloading or storage of cargo, if any, and ships’ stores.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (4), no person shall enter or remain in a restricted area unless they are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of a restricted area pass;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person being escorted by the holder of a restricted area pass;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a security inspector designated under subsection 22(1) of the Act who is on duty;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a federal, provincial or municipal government employee who requires access to the area in the performance of their duties; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a provider of emergency services who requires access to the area for the protection and preservation of life or property.

Subsection.Text: The holder of a restricted area pass who escorts another person in a restricted area in accordance with paragraph (1)(b) shall remain with the person or ensure that another holder of a restricted area pass acts as the escort.
A person being escorted in a restricted area in accordance with paragraph (1)(b) shall remain with the escort while in the restricted area.
A passenger may enter and remain in a restricted area identified by the operator as a passenger area if the passenger is in possession of a valid ticket.

Section.Text: No person shall provide another person with access to a restricted area or assistance in entering a restricted area unless the person accessing the restricted area is authorized to do so under section81.

The security plan in respect of a domestic ferry and the security plan in respect of a domestic ferry facility shall contain security procedures for restricted areas, as appropriate to the operations of the ferry or the ferry facility, in order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: identify persons authorized to have access to those areas;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: determine the conditions under which a person being escorted in accordance with paragraph 81(1)(b) is authorized to have access to those areas;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: define the extent of any restricted area;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: establish the times when access restrictions apply; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: clearly mark restricted areas.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a domestic ferry, security procedures for restricted areas at MARSEC level 1 shall be established in the security plan in respect of the ferry, as appropriate to its operations, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: locking or securing access points;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: monitoring and using surveillance equipment;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: using security guards or patrols; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: using automatic intrusion detection devices to alert ferry personnel to unauthorized access.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a domestic ferry facility, security procedures for restricted areas at MARSEC level 1 shall be established in the security plan in respect of the ferry facility, as appropriate to its operations, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: limiting access to authorized personnel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: securing all access points not actively used and providing physical barriers to impede movement through the remaining access points;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: controlling access to restricted areas;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: checking the identification and authorization of persons and vehicles seeking access;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: patrolling or monitoring the perimeter of restricted areas;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: using security personnel, automatic intrusion detection devices, surveillance equipment or surveillance systems to detect any unauthorized access into or movement in restricted areas;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: directing the parking, loading and unloading of vehicles in restricted areas;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: controlling the movement and storage of cargo, if any, ships’ stores, and bunkers; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: designating restricted areas for performing inspections of cargo, if any, and ships’ stores that are awaiting loading.

Subsection.Text: The security plan in respect of a domestic ferry facility shall include a requirement that, if a temporary restricted area is designated, a security sweep of it shall be conducted both before and after it is designated.

In the case of a domestic ferry, additional security procedures for restricted areas at MARSEC level 2 shall be established in the security plan in respect of the ferry, as appropriate to its operations, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: increasing the frequency and intensity of monitoring and access control in restricted areas;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: establishing restricted areas adjacent to access points;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: continuously monitoring each area using surveillance equipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the assignment of additional personnel to guard or patrol each area.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a domestic ferry facility, additional security procedures for restricted areas at MARSEC level 2 shall be established in the security plan in respect of the ferry facility, as appropriate to its operations, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: increasing the frequency and intensity of monitoring and access control in restricted areas;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: enhancing the effectiveness of the physical barriers surrounding restricted areas by the use of patrols or automatic intrusion detection devices;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reducing the number of access points for restricted areas and enhancing the controls applied at the remaining access points;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: restricting the parking of vehicles adjacent to ferries;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: reducing access to restricted areas, and movements and storage in those areas;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: using surveillance equipment that records and monitors continuously;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: increasing the number and frequency of security patrols, including the use of waterborne patrols; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: establishing areas adjacent to restricted areas and restricting access to those areas.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a domestic ferry, additional security procedures for restricted areas at MARSEC level 3 shall be established in the security plan in respect of the ferry, as appropriate to its operations, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: establishing of additional restricted areas on the ferry in proximity to the location of a security incident or the presumed location of a security threat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: searching restricted areas as part of a security sweep of the ferry.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a domestic ferry facility, additional security procedures for restricted areas at MARSEC level 3 shall be established in the security plan in respect of the ferry facility, as appropriate to its operations, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: designating additional restricted areas;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prohibiting access to restricted areas; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: searching restricted areas as part of a security sweep of all or part of the ferry facility.
